speaker: Heart-stone
lines: Your fingers find seams too fine for sight.
The heart-stone loosens; something old wishes to be carried again.
Grains of glittering mica spill out like ground stars.
You feel the heft of histories: raids turned back, winters turned aside.
Every relic is a promise made by someone who kept it.
You decide which promise will ride with you.
